relevant_findings.description: Hypotension, flaccid paralysis of the right side, diminished breath sounds over the lower right lung field, dry mucous membranes, right-sided facial droop, brisk reflexes on the right side, prolonged capillary refill of 4 to 5 seconds.

serological_parameters.cerebrospinal_fluid: 400 erythrocytes per cubic millimeter, no leukocytes

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Weakness progressively increased leading to further paralysis and respiratory distress before the physical examination.

relevant_findings.description: Right arm and leg were flaccid; reflexes were more brisk on the right side than on the left side.
Facial droop and flaccid paralysis resolved over time, allowing the patient to stand unassisted.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Gradual improvement with regained strength and ability to walk after discharge.
